title: Pressure - force on two cylinders at same depth

content.prompt: Two small cylinders have the same height h but different diameters. The diameters of cylinders 1 and 2 are d and 2d, respectively. The cylinders are resting on a flat surface at the bottom of a pool, as shown in the figure. A student claims the force exerted by the water on the top surface each cylinder is the same. Which of the following indicates whether the claim is correct and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The claim is correct, because the pressure on the top surface of each cylinder is the same.
The claim is correct, because the density and height of the fluid above each cylinder is the same.
The claim is incorrect, because the pressure at the surface of each cylinder is the same but the area of the top surface of each cylinder is different.
The claim is incorrect, because Cylinder 1 has a smaller surface area so the pressure at the top surface of Cylinder 1 is greater than the pressure at the top surface of Cylinder 2.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
